intro: Sida rhombifolia var. pohliana, commonly known as the narrowleaf sida, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its rhombic-shaped leaves and small, clustered flowers that typically range in color from white to pale pink. The plant is native to the Americas and is often found in dry, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and sandy soils. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds, facilitating its spread in suitable environments. The species is noted for its adaptability to various soil types and its ability to thrive in arid conditions.
